TopicDetails.title: Cultural Cooperation Projects in the Western Balkans “Strengthening cultural cooperation with and competiveness of cultural and creative industries in the Western Balkans”
TopicDetails.callTitle: Cultural Cooperation Projects in the Western Balkans “Strengthening cultural cooperation with and competiveness of cultural and creative industries in the Western Balkans”

latestInfos.content: As a result of the difficulties by applicants due to the COVID-19 outbreak, we have extended the deadline of this Call. The new deadline is 28 April 2020 at 5pm.

TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

The overall objective of this Call is to foster reconciliation and good neighbourly relations in the Western Balkans through cultural cooperation and creation.

The specific objectives of this Call are:

  • to increase cultural cross-border cooperation within the Western Balkans region and the EU Member States;
  • to strengthen the competitiveness of the cultural and creative industries in the region.

In order to achieve the above-mentioned objectives, this Call focuses on the following priorities:

  • Increase the capacity of cultural and creative industries to operate transnationally and internationally
  • Increase transnational circulation of cultural and creative works and transnational mobility of cultural and creative players
  • Enhance inter-cultural dialogue between artists, cultural operators as well as the general public
TopicDetails.conditions:
1. Eligible countries: See section 6 of the Call's Guidelines, available at:

https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/sites/ipa/funding/coopwb  

2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: 

Admissibility: see section 5 of the Call's Guidelines.

Eligibility: see section 6 of the Call's Guidelines.

Full information and documents related to the call are available at the following link: 

https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/sites/ipa/funding/coopwb

3. Evaluation criteria and process: see details under section 9 of the Call's Guidelines.

Full information and documents related to the call are available at the following link: 

https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/sites/ipa/funding/coopwb

Please read carefully all provisions before the preparation of your application.

4. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreements:  :

Publication of the call:                                     December 17, 2019

Deadline for submitting applications:              March 17, 2020 17:00 (Brussels Time)

Evaluation period:                                           March-June 2020

Information to applicants:                               July 2020

Signature of grant agreement:                        September-December 2020 (no later than 31/12/2020)
TopicDetails.supportInfo:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

In order to prepare their application, applicants may use the support of the Creative Europe Desks financed by the Creative Europe: Programme. For any further information please contact your Creative Europe Desk in your country:
https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/creative-europe/contact_en

For further assistance related to this call, please contact the Education Audiovisual and Culture Executive Agency at: EACEA-IPA-WESTERN-BALKANS-PROJECTS@ec.europa.eu

If, after referring to the e-Form User Guide you still have a question or have encountered a technical problem in relation to the e-Form, please contact the HelpDesk services.

  • Helpdesk e-mail address: eacea-helpdesk@ec.europa.eu
  • HelpDesk phone: +32 2 299 0705

 IT Helpdesk – Contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc

callDetailsJSONItem.staticAdditionalInfo:
This call is based on Regulation (EU) No 231/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 March 2014 establishing an Instrument for Pre-accession Assistance (IPA II) (OJ L 77, dated 15/03/2014, p. 11–26), hereafter referred to as 'the Regulation'.

The present call implements the provisions of Commission Implementing Decision C(2019) 5515, dated 19/07/2019, adopting a Multi-country Action Programme for the year 2019.
